title: Keynote: Futnani on engaging superpowers in MENA and beyond - TXF
summary: The article discusses the role of Middle East and North Africa (MENA) Export Credit Agencies (ECAs) in project and development finance, with a focus on their efforts to support the energy transition. The article highlights the importance of green and sustainable financing, with HSBC setting a target of deploying $750 billion to $1 trillion towards sustainability by 2030. The article also mentions the development of new products and the pace of change for ECAs in recent years, particularly in response to the pandemic and the need to support the energy transition.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes the need for new green and sustainable financing products to support the energy transition, which is an example of green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE. The article does not describe any specific new business processes or products that meet the criteria to be a business innovation.
green_product: TRUE. The article mentions the first large green hydrogen project signed on 1 March, which is an example of a green product.
green_process: FALSE. The article does not describe any specific green processes.
